title: US beef off the menu as the trade war hits Beijing's American-style restaurants
4 teens who died in Marin County crash identified; somber crowd attends vigil
Final days of Pope who joined Vatican crowds at Easter despite doctors' advice
description: Francis did what he had always done, receiving visitors and meeting people from every walk of life.

title: US stocks and dollar plunge as Trump attacks Fed chair Powell
description: The president amps up attack against US central bank boss calling him "a major loser" for not lowering interest rates.

title: Nomura to buy Macquarie's U.S. and European public asset management business for $1.8 billion
description: This would increase the assets under management of Nomura's investment management division to $770 billion, up from the $590 billion currently.

title: Tesla shares tumble ahead of first-quarter earnings report
description: Tesla shares dropped almost 6% on Monday, a day before the company is scheduled to release first-quarter earnings.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Australia Election: PM Albanese's Party Holds Slim Lead As Voting Begins
description: Early voting in the Australian election began on Tuesday, with Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's centre-left Labor party holding a slim lead over the conservative opposition coalition.

title: Delta Plane Catches Fire, Passengers Evacuated On Emergency Slides
description: A Delta Air Lines flight caught fire on the tarmac at Orlando International Airport on Monday (local time), following which the passengers had to evacuate via the emergency slides, CNN reported.

title: Francis, the First Latin American Pope, Dies at 88
description: After decades of conservative leadership, Francis tried to reset the course of the Roman Catholic Church, emphasizing inclusion and care for the marginalized over doctrinal purity.
author: Jason Horowitz and Jim Yardley

title: Latest Updates: World Pays Tribute to Pope Francis
description: The Vatican said Francis, the first pope from Latin America, had died after a stroke, and revealed that his will requested a simple tomb in Rome.
author: The New York Times

title: Latest Updates: Pope Francis Dies at 88 - The New York Times
description: Latest Updates: Pope Francis Dies at 88  The New York TimesPope Francis dies at 88 from stroke and heart failure, Vatican says: Live updates and reactions  YahooWho is Cardinal Kevin Farrell? title: 'What a ridiculous situation': Trump lashes out at courts over immigration delays
description: Donald Trump has criticised the US judicial system, including the Supreme Court, for allegedly obstructing his efforts to deport undocumented immigrants, including those he labelled as violent criminals and terrorists. Trump claimed the courts were reluctant to allow deportations, particularly to countries like Venezuela.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Harvard files lawsuit to pause Trump’s $2.2 billion funding freeze
description: Harvard University has filed a lawsuit against the Trump administration, challenging the freeze on over $2.2 billion in federal funding. The university argues that the funding freeze is unlawful and exceeds the government's authority. The lawsuit, filed in a Massachusetts federal court, claims the administration is attempting to control academic decision-making, violating the First Amendment and other federal laws.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Wild chimpanzees filmed by scientists bonding over alcoholic fruit
description: Footage of apes consuming fermented breadfruit leads researchers to ask if it may shed light on origins of human feastingHumans have gathered to feast and enjoy a tipple together for thousands of years, but research suggests chimpanzees may also bond over a boozy treat.Wild chimpanzees in west Africa have been observed sharing fruit containing alcohol – not in quantities to get roaring drunk but, possibly, enough for a fuzzy beer buzz feeling. Continue reading...
author: Steven Morris

title: Tunisian court hands prison sentences of up to 66 years in mass trial of regime opponents
description: Opposition says trial was staged to entrench president Kais Saied’s authoritarian ruleA Tunisian court has handed down prison sentences of 13 to 66 years to politicians, businessmen and lawyers in a mass trial that opponents say is fabricated and a symbol of president Kais Saied’s authoritarian rule.Businessman Kamel Ltaif received the longest sentence of 66 years on Saturday, while opposition politician Khayam Turki was given a 48-year jail term, a lawyer for the defendants said. Continue reading...
author: Reuters

title: Pope Francis was a globalist in an age of nationalists
description: Pope Francis saw himself as a “globalist,” but not in the terms laid out by those who revile “globalism.”
author: Ishaan Tharoor

title: Obituary: The life and legacy of Pope Francis
author: Anthony Faiola
